A suburb of the expansive Houston, Webster has become forever associated with NASA and the bay area.

value: content=Rocket park is available for personal tours, though the Saturn V rocket is covered for maintenance.
address=1601 NASA Road 1, Webster (located 25 miles south of downtown Houston in the NASA/Clear Lake area)
hours=Summer hours: June 10am-7pm, July 9am-7pm, August 10am-5pm, 10am-7pm Weekends.  Winter hours: Mon-Fri 10am-5pm, Sat-Sun 10am-6pm.
price=$17.95 Adults, $13.95 Children (4-11), discounts for seniors. Parking $5

content=Indoor fun space museum with lots of hands-on space-science exhibits and artifacts from the full history of U.S. space exploration.  A big hit with kids, but informative for adults. A highlight are the two tram tours of NASA's Johnson Space Center, one of which includes a visit to Mission Control and actual Apollo and Mercury launch vehicles, the other focuses on astronaut training facilities.
